alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 6:22PM EDT until July 24 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... North Central Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... Northeastern Calhoun County in the panhandle of Florida... * Until 715 PM CDT /815 PM EDT/. * At 522 PM CDT /622 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Torreya State Park, Selman, Ocheesee, Macedonia, Henderson Mill, Rock Bluff and Roy. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
